Name: Azurite
Description: Some gems have hidden qualities beyond their luster, beyond their shine... Azurite is one of those gems.

Name: Bloodstone
Description: Origin of the Bloodstone is unknown, hence its low value. It has a very high shine and 12 sides, however.

Name: Zircon
Description: A transparent pale blue-green gemstone worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Emerald
Description: A transparent deep bright green emerald worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Blue Sapphire
Description: A transparent blue corundum worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Ruby
Description: A transparent deep crimson corundum worth 5,000 gold pieces.

Name: Black Opal
Description: A transparent dark green with black mottling and golden flecks worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Fire Opal
Description: A transparent fiery red with yellow and orange mottling worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Star Ruby
Description: A transparent ruby with a star-shaped center that glows in sunlight worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Star Sapphire
Description: A transparent blue corundum with a star-shaped center that glows in sunlight worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Diamond
Description: A transparent blue-white gemstone worth 5,000 gold pieces.

Name: Jacinth
Description: A transparent fiery orange gemstone worth 5,000 gold pieces.

Name: Amber
Description: A transparent watery gold, red, or brown, or transparent pale green, brown, or yellow-green, worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Amethyst
Description: A transparent deep purple, worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Chrysoberyl
Description: A transparent yellow-green to pale green, worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Coral
Description: A pink, red, or orange piece of coral, worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Garnet
Description: A transparent red, brown-green, or violet garnet worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Jade
Description: A translucent green, white, or yellow-green stone worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Jet
Description: A deep black stone, worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Pearl
Description: A lustrous white, yellow, or pink orb worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Spinel
Description: A transparent red, red-brown, or deep green crystal worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Tourmaline
Description: A transparent pale green, blue, brown, or red gem worth 100 gold pieces.

Name: Turquoise
Description: A smooth opaque blue-green stone with small flecks of pyrite worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Aquamarine
Description: A transparent pale blue-green gem worth 500 gold pieces.

Name: Alexandrite
Description: A transparent dark green gem worth 500 gold pieces.

Name: Black Pearl
Description: A lustrous black, gray, or purple pearl worth 500 gold pieces.

Name: Peridot
Description: An olive-green gem worth 500 gold pieces.

Name: Topaz
Description: A transparent golden yellow, yellow-brown, or blue gem worth 500 gold pieces.

Name: Jasper
Description: An opaque reddish-brown gem worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Moonstone
Description: A transparent white with pale blue glow worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Onyx
Description: An opaque bands of black and white, or pure black or white worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Sardonyx
Description: An opaque bands of red and white worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Banded Agate
Description: An opaque striped brown, blue, white, or red worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Eye Agate
Description: An opaque circle of white with a central eye of brown, gray, blue, or green worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Moss Agate
Description: An opaque pink or yellow-white with mossy gray or green markings worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Hematite
Description: An opaque gray-black stone worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Lapis Lazuli
Description: An opaque light and dark blue with yellow flecks worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Malachite
Description: An opaque striated light and dark green stone worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Obsidian
Description: An opaque black stone worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Rhodochrosite
Description: An opaque light pink gem worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Tiger Eye
Description: An opaque brown with golden center stone worth 10 gold pieces.

Name: Carnelian
Description: An opaque red-brown gem worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Chalcedony
Description: An opaque white gem worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Chrysoprase
Description: An opaque green gem worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Citrine
Description: An opaque yellow-brown gem worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Quartz
Description: An opaque white, smoky gray, or yellow crystal worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Star Rose Quartz
Description: An opaque rosy stone with white star-shaped center worth 50 gold pieces.

Name: Blue Spinel
Description: An opaque deep blue gem worth 500 gold pieces.

Name: Yellow Sapphire
Description: An opaque yellow corundum worth 1,000 gold pieces.

Name: Black Sapphire
Description: An opaque black corundum worth 5,000 gold pieces.

Name: Padded
Description: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

Name: Leather
Description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Name: Studded Leather
Description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Name: Hide
Description: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

Name: Chain Shirt
Description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Name: Scale Mail
Description: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

Name: Breastplate
Description: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

Name: Half Plate
Description: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

Name: Ring Mail
Description: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

Name: Chain Mail
Description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

Name: Splint
Description: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

Name: Plate
Description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Name: Shield
Description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Name: Club
Description: A club is a short, heavy stick. A club can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Dagger
Description: A dagger is a small weapon that can be used as a melee weapon or as a ranged weapon.

Name: Greatclub
Description: A greatclub is a larger version of a club. A greatclub can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Handaxe
Description: A handaxe is a small axe that can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Light Hammer
Description: A light hammer is a small, light hammer that can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Quarterstaff
Description: A quarterstaff is a simple two-handed melee weapon.

Name: Javelin
Description: A javelin is a light spear that is thrown at a target.

Name: Mace
Description: A mace is a light, hafted weapon that can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Sickle
Description: A sickle is a light, hafted weapon that is used to cut through undergrowth. A sickle can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Spear
Description: A spear is a versatile hafted weapon that can be used either as a melee weapon or as a ranged weapon. A spear can be thrown.

Name: Whip
Description: A whip is a thin, flexible cord with a series of small barbs near the end. A whip can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Battleaxe
Description: A battleaxe is a heavy hafted weapon that can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Flail
Description: A flail is a hafted weapon that can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Glaive
Description: A glaive is a heavy, bladed polearm. A glaive can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Greataxe
Description: A greataxe is a heavy two-handed axe and a melee weapon.

Name: Greatsword
Description: A greatsword is a heavy two-handed sword and a melee weapon.

Name: Halberd
Description: A halberd is a heavy, hafted weapon that can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Lance
Description: A lance is a reach weapon that consists of a long wooden haft with a pointed metal head.

Name: Longsword
Description: A longsword is a versatile weapon with a long blade that can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Maul
Description: A maul is a heavy two-handed hammer and a melee weapon.

Name: Morningstar
Description: A morningstar is a hafted weapon with a spiked metal head. A morningstar can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Pike
Description: A pike is a reach weapon that has a long haft topped with a spearhead. A pike can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Rapier
Description: A rapier is a long, lightweight sword with a sharp point. A rapier can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Scimitar
Description: A scimitar is a curved sword with a sharp edge that is used for slashing attacks. A scimitar can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Shortsword
Description: A shortsword is a small, light sword that can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Trident
Description: A trident is a three-pronged spear that can be thrown. A trident can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: War Pick
Description: A war pick is a hafted weapon with a spiked metal head. A war pick can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Warhammer
Description: A warhammer is a heavy, hafted weapon that can be used as a melee weapon.

Name: Crossbow, Light
Description: A light crossbow is a small crossbow that can be used as a ranged weapon.

Name: Dart
Description: A dart is a small, thin object with a sharp point that is designed to be thrown at a target. A dart can be used as a ranged weapon.

Name: Shortbow
Description: A shortbow is a short, light bow that can be used as a ranged weapon.

Name: Sling
Description: A sling is a small strap with a pouch at the end. A sling can be used as a ranged weapon.

Name: Blowgun
Description: A blowgun is a small tube through which a dart can be blown. A blowgun can be used as a ranged weapon.

Name: Crossbow, Hand
Description: A hand crossbow is a small crossbow that can be used as a ranged weapon.

Name: Crossbow, Heavy
Description: A heavy crossbow is a large crossbow that can be used as a ranged weapon.

Name: Longbow
Description: A longbow is a long, powerful bow that can be used as a ranged weapon.
